title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 800.10 - Storage
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 800.10 - Storage

State Regulations

Storage charges are charges made on freight remaining on
docks, wharfs, warehouses, or in or on any commission property or facility, after allowed free time period, as named in storage tariff. All lumber, shingles and lath, remaining in Truck Delivery yard (not backpiled) after
expiration of free time will be assessed a daily storage charge as outlined in
the commission storage tariff. Storage charges on shipments for outward water
movement will be assessed against and collected from the steamship companies, and the steamship companies will collect for their own account any of these
charges not absorbed by them. Storage charges on shipments received from
vessels will be assessed against consignees, direct, by the commission, unless
it be evident that the steamship company is responsible for incurring such
charges; in which case, same will be assessed against the steamship company. After the expiration of free time, all cargo (except woodpulp and manila hemp)
remaining in transit sheds will be moved to warehouse, as named in tariff of
terminal charges. Notes

800.10

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
